ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE: Together ppGpp and DksA can inhibit more strongly the transcription initiation from the ribosomal protein promoter in vitro and in vivo |CITS:[21402902]|.
ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE_WEB: Together ppGpp and DksA can inhibit more strongly the transcription initiation from the ribosomal protein promoter in vitro and in vivo Lemke JJ,2011

ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE: DskA amplifies the magnitude of inhibition effects of ppGpp from rrnBp1 and all rRNAP1 promoters |CITS:[15294157][21402902]|. A model reflecting the contribution of DksA under regulation of rRNA expression has been developed |CITS:[15294157]|.
ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE_WEB: DskA amplifies the magnitude of inhibition effects of ppGpp from rrnBp1 and all rRNAP1 promoters Paul BJ,2004. Lemke JJ,2011 A model reflecting the contribution of DksA under regulation of rRNA expression has been developed Paul BJ,2004

ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE: ppGpp and DksA act directly and synergistically to negatively control dusBp transcription in vitro, reducing the lifetime of the competitor-resistant complex with RNA polymerase |CITS:[16885445]|. DksA is required for inhibition of dusB p transcription during mid- and late log growth and in stationary phase |CITS:[16885445]|. DksA negatively controls dusBp for normal growth-phase-dependent regulation of dusB-fisoperon |CITS:[16885445]|. Moreover, DksA inhibits transcription, in part by further destabilizing intrinsically unstable promoter complexes |CITS:[16885445]|. Finally, it was shown that DksA not only amplifies the sensitivity of dusB-fis operon to ppGpp but also it increases the concentration of the initiating NTP required for transcription |CITS:[16885445]|.
ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE_WEB: ppGpp and DksA act directly and synergistically to negatively control dusBp transcription in vitro, reducing the lifetime of the competitor-resistant complex with RNA polymerase Mallik P,2006 DksA is required for inhibition of dusB p transcription during mid- and late log growth and in stationary phase Mallik P,2006 DksA negatively controls dusBp for normal growth-phase-dependent regulation of dusB-fisoperon Mallik P,2006 Moreover, DksA inhibits transcription, in part by further destabilizing intrinsically unstable promoter complexes Mallik P,2006 Finally, it was shown that DksA not only amplifies the sensitivity of dusB-fis operon to ppGpp but also it increases the concentration of the initiating NTP required for transcription Mallik P,2006

ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE: ppGpp is the main negative regulator of pcnBp4 (pS2) in vivo. DksA had little effect in inhibiting the activity of pcnBp4(pS2). However, DksA enhanced the inhibitory effect of ppGpp |CITS:[20700605]|.
ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE_WEB: ppGpp is the main negative regulator of pcnBp4 (pS2) in vivo. DksA had little effect in inhibiting the activity of pcnBp4(pS2). However, DksA enhanced the inhibitory effect of ppGpp Nadratowska-Wesolowska B,2010

ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE: ppGpp binds RNA polymerase (RNAP) near the catalytic center in the secondary channel |CITS:[15109491]|. Its binding is proposed to be stabilized by DskA. If the demand for rRNA is low, transcription can be inhibited by high levels of ppGpp or low levels of NTPs. RNAP is a direct target of ppGpp action. There are three proposed mechanisms through which ppGpp binding inhibits rRNA transcription: 1) ppGpp binds with the initiating NTP for the active site, 2) ppGpp pairs with a cytosine residue(s) just upstream of the transcription start site, 3) ppGpp decreases the lifetime of the open complex formed at all rRNA promoters |CITS:[15109491]|.
ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE_WEB: ppGpp binds RNA polymerase (RNAP) near the catalytic center in the secondary channel Artsimovitch I, Patlan V, Sekine S, Vassylyeva MN, Hosaka T, Ochi K, Yokoyama S, Vassylyev DG,2004 Its binding is proposed to be stabilized by DskA. If the demand for rRNA is low, transcription can be inhibited by high levels of ppGpp or low levels of NTPs. RNAP is a direct target of ppGpp action. There are three proposed mechanisms through which ppGpp binding inhibits rRNA transcription: 1) ppGpp binds with the initiating NTP for the active site, 2) ppGpp pairs with a cytosine residue(s) just upstream of the transcription start site, 3) ppGpp decreases the lifetime of the open complex formed at all rRNA promoters Artsimovitch I, Patlan V, Sekine S, Vassylyeva MN, Hosaka T, Ochi K, Yokoyama S, Vassylyev DG,2004

ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE:
ppGpp binds RNA polymerase (RNAP) near the catalytic center in the secondary channel |CITS:[15109491]|. Its binding is proposed to be stabilized by DskA. If the demand for rRNA is low, transcription can be inhibited by high levels of ppGpp or low levels of NTPs. RNAP is a direct target of ppGpp action. There are three proposed mechanisms through which ppGpp binding inhibits rRNA transcription: 1) ppGpp binds with the initiating NTP for the active site, 2) ppGpp pairs with a cytosine residue(s) just upstream of the transcription start site, 3) ppGpp decreases the lifetime of the open complex formed at all rRNA promoters |CITS:[15109491]|.
The regulatory effects on transcription initiation and properties between (p)ppApp with (p)ppGpp were assessed using the well-studied E. coli rrnBP1 promoter. Different from (p)ppGpp, (p)ppApp activates transcription at this promoter, and DksA hinders this effect; in contrast, pppApp exerts a stronger effect than ppApp. The X-ray crystal structure of the RNAP-(p)ppApp complex was determined and which shows that the analogs bind near the active site and switch regions of RNAP |CITS:[30013537]|.
ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE_WEB:
ppGpp binds RNA polymerase (RNAP) near the catalytic center in the secondary channel Artsimovitch I, Patlan V, Sekine S, Vassylyeva MN, Hosaka T, Ochi K, Yokoyama S, Vassylyev DG,2004 Its binding is proposed to be stabilized by DskA. If the demand for rRNA is low, transcription can be inhibited by high levels of ppGpp or low levels of NTPs. RNAP is a direct target of ppGpp action. There are three proposed mechanisms through which ppGpp binding inhibits rRNA transcription: 1) ppGpp binds with the initiating NTP for the active site, 2) ppGpp pairs with a cytosine residue(s) just upstream of the transcription start site, 3) ppGpp decreases the lifetime of the open complex formed at all rRNA promoters Artsimovitch I, Patlan V, Sekine S, Vassylyeva MN, Hosaka T, Ochi K, Yokoyama S, Vassylyev DG,2004
The regulatory effects on transcription initiation and properties between (p)ppApp with (p)ppGpp were assessed using the well-studied E. coli rrnBP1 promoter. Different from (p)ppGpp, (p)ppApp activates transcription at this promoter, and DksA hinders this effect; in contrast, pppApp exerts a stronger effect than ppApp. The X-ray crystal structure of the RNAP-(p)ppApp complex was determined and which shows that the analogs bind near the active site and switch regions of RNAP Klitgaard RN,2018

ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE: ppGpp is able to inhibit dusBp (fisp) expression slightly in the absence of DksA |CITS:[15294157]|. However, ppGpp and DksA are required for normal stringent control of dusBp. Both act directly and synergistically to negatively control dusBp transcription in vitro |CITS:[16885445]|.
ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE_WEB: ppGpp is able to inhibit dusBp (fisp) expression slightly in the absence of DksA Paul BJ,2004 However, ppGpp and DksA are required for normal stringent control of dusBp. Both act directly and synergistically to negatively control dusBp transcription in vitro Mallik P,2006

ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE: pyrLp2 (pyrBp2) contains a G+C-rich sequence immediately dowstream of the _10 region that is similar to the discriminator sequence found in stringently controlled promoters |CITS:[1699940]|.
ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE_WEB: pyrLp2 (pyrBp2) contains a G+C-rich sequence immediately dowstream of the _10 region that is similar to the discriminator sequence found in stringently controlled promoters Donahue JP,1990

ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE: ppGpp regulates the expression of the grxB gene together with σS and σ70 during the exponential and stationary phases, respectively |CITS: [11889138]|.
ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE_WEB: ppGpp regulates the expression of the grxB gene together with σS and σ70 during the exponential and stationary phases, respectively Potamitou A,2002.

ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE: leuO expression is induced indirectly via an increase in the cellular Lrp level in response to a ppGpp level increase, which is caused by the slow growth rate as cells enter stationary phase |CITS:[11006083]|.
ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE_WEB: leuO expression is induced indirectly via an increase in the cellular Lrp level in response to a ppGpp level increase, which is caused by the slow growth rate as cells enter stationary phase Fang M,2000

ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE: ftsQp1, ftsZp4, and ftsZp3 are attractive candidates for ppGpp activation, since they exhibit inverse growth rate regulation. Even so, the effect of ppGpp on the ftsZ gene could be indirect |CITS:[8407846]|.
ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE_WEB: ftsQp1, ftsZp4, and ftsZp3 are attractive candidates for ppGpp activation, since they exhibit inverse growth rate regulation. Even so, the effect of ppGpp on the ftsZ gene could be indirect Vinella D,1993

ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE: ftsQp1, ftsZp4, and ftsZp3 are attractive candidates for ppGpp activation, since they exhibit inverse growth rate regulation. Even so, the effect of ppGpp on the ftsZ gene could be indirect |CITS:[8407846]|.
ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE_WEB: ftsQp1, ftsZp4, and ftsZp3 are attractive candidates for ppGpp activation, since they exhibit inverse growth rate regulation. Even so, the effect of ppGpp on the ftsZ gene could be indirect Vinella D,1993

ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE: The positive effect of ppGpp on RelA is through its effect on the kcat' and not the Km. This effect is amplified by ribosomal protein L11 and deacylated RNAPhe and mRNA |CITS:[22907080]|.
ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE_WEB: The positive effect of ppGpp on RelA is through its effect on the kcat' and not the Km. This effect is amplified by ribosomal protein L11 and deacylated RNAPhe and mRNA Goodman C.,2012

ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE: ppGpp and its cofactor, DksA, inhibit in two ways the transcription of fabHp: 1) they directly inhibit its transcription, and 2) they inhibit fadR expression, which is an activator of the fabHDG operon |CITS:[23772072]|.
ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE_WEB: ppGpp and its cofactor, DksA, inhibit in two ways the transcription of fabHp: 1) they directly inhibit its transcription, and 2) they inhibit fadR expression, which is an activator of the fabHDG operon My L,2013

ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE: Upon amino acid starvation, rpsBp is negatively regulated by ppGpp due to the presence of the GC-rich discriminator, whose substitution for the AT-rich element abolished stringent control |CITS:[25365487]|.
ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE_WEB: Upon amino acid starvation, rpsBp is negatively regulated by ppGpp due to the presence of the GC-rich discriminator, whose substitution for the AT-rich element abolished stringent control Aseev LV,2014

ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE: ppGpp regulates positively the expression of lrp, but it may not be entirely responsible for growth-phase regulation |CITS:[8955316]|.
ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE_WEB: ppGpp regulates positively the expression of lrp, but it may not be entirely responsible for growth-phase regulation Landgraf JR,1996

ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE: The rplM-rpsI operon is regulated by ppGpp-DksA-dependent negative stringent control under amino acid starvation, most likely due to the features of the discriminator region (G/C rich) separating the -10 promoter element from the transcription start site (TSS) |CITS:[ 27381917]|.
ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE_WEB: The rplM-rpsI operon is regulated by ppGpp-DksA-dependent negative stringent control under amino acid starvation, most likely due to the features of the discriminator region (G/C rich) separating the -10 promoter element from the transcription start site (TSS) Aseev LV,2016

ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE: The rpmB-rpmG operon is regulated by ppGpp-DksA-dependent negative stringent control under amino acid starvation, most likely due to the features of the discriminator region (G/C rich) separating the -10 promoter element from the transcription start site (TSS) |CITS:[ 27381917]|.
ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE_WEB: The rpmB-rpmG operon is regulated by ppGpp-DksA-dependent negative stringent control under amino acid starvation, most likely due to the features of the discriminator region (G/C rich) separating the -10 promoter element from the transcription start site (TSS) Aseev LV,2016

ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE: The rplU-rpmA operon is regulated by ppGpp-DksA-dependent negative stringent control under amino acid starvation, most likely due to the features of the discriminator region (G/C rich) separating the -10 promoter element from the transcription start site (TSS) |CITS: [27381917]|.
ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE_WEB: The rplU-rpmA operon is regulated by ppGpp-DksA-dependent negative stringent control under amino acid starvation, most likely due to the features of the discriminator region (G/C rich) separating the -10 promoter element from the transcription start site (TSS) Aseev LV,2016.

ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE:
The argT promoter is negatively affected by ppGpp in vivo |CITS:[7680341]| and in vitro during the stringent response |CITS: [11035017]|.
Based on results of nuclease protection and primer extension assays, leuV, argT, metT, and leuX were determined to be involved in the stringent response induced by serine hydroxamate |CITS: [7680341]|.
ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE_WEB:
The argT promoter is negatively affected by ppGpp in vivo Rowley KB,1993and in vitro during the stringent response Toulokhonov II,2001.
Based on results of nuclease protection and primer extension assays, leuV, argT, metT, and leuX were determined to be involved in the stringent response induced by serine hydroxamate Rowley KB,1993.

ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE: Based on results of nuclease protection and primer extension assays, leuV, argT, metT, and leuX were determined to be involved in the stringent response induced by serine hydroxamate |CITS: [7680341]|.

ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE: serWp2 appears to be under stringent control, since the -10 region is followed by a GCGCCCC (G/C-rich) sequence characteristic of promoters regulated by ppGpp |CITS:[7518257][6154042]|. This would negatively affect serW transcription as well as other tRNAs |CITS:[6154042]|.
ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE_WEB: serWp2 appears to be under stringent control, since the -10 region is followed by a GCGCCCC (G/C-rich) sequence characteristic of promoters regulated by ppGpp Cummings HS,1994. Travers AA,1980 This would negatively affect serW transcription as well as other tRNAs Travers AA,1980

ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE: The binding of ppGpp to mnmG and mioC genes was evaluated in Escherichia coli W3110 |CITS: [1745229]|.
ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE_WEB: The binding of ppGpp to mnmG and mioC genes was evaluated in Escherichia coli W3110 Ogawa T,1991.

ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE: DksA-ppGpp activate the iraP promoter, improving σS stability |CITS:[29061665]|. On the other hand, DksA-ppGpp can increase iraP expression indirectly by another mechanism, possibly by reducing rRNA transcription and thereby increasing RNAP availability |CITS:[29061665]|.
ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE_WEB: DksA-ppGpp activate the iraP promoter, improving σS stability Girard ME,2018 On the other hand, DksA-ppGpp can increase iraP expression indirectly by another mechanism, possibly by reducing rRNA transcription and thereby increasing RNAP availability Girard ME,2018

ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE: DksA and ppGpp activate the dsrA promoter, improving rpoS translation |CITS:[29061665]|. On the other hand, DksA-ppGpp can increase dsrA expression indirectly by another mechanism, possibly by reducing rRNA transcription and thereby increasing RNAP availability |CITS:[29061665]|.
ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE_WEB: DksA and ppGpp activate the dsrA promoter, improving rpoS translation Girard ME,2018 On the other hand, DksA-ppGpp can increase dsrA expression indirectly by another mechanism, possibly by reducing rRNA transcription and thereby increasing RNAP availability Girard ME,2018

ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE: rmf transcription is induced positively and directly by cellular ppGpp concentrations rather than by the decreased growth rate |CITS:[11532026]|.
ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE_WEB: rmf transcription is induced positively and directly by cellular ppGpp concentrations rather than by the decreased growth rate Izutsu K,2001

ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE: The nucleotide sequence (GCGC) from positions -7 to -4 (with respect to the transcription start site of the thrUp promoter) is responsible for the inhibition of the thrU-tyrU-glyT-thrT-tufB operon by ppGpp (0.2 μM) during stringent control |CITS:[2990906]|.
ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE_WEB: The nucleotide sequence (GCGC) from positions -7 to -4 (with respect to the transcription start site of the thrUp promoter) is responsible for the inhibition of the thrU-tyrU-glyT-thrT-tufB operon by ppGpp (0.2 μM) during stringent control Mizushima-Sugano J,1985

ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE: ppGpp can induce qor expression either directly or indirectly in parallel with the stringent response |CITS:[12123445]|.
ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE_WEB: ppGpp can induce qor expression either directly or indirectly in parallel with the stringent response Chang DE,2002

ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE: ppGpp binds RNA polymerase (RNAP) near the catalytic center in the secondary channel |CITS:[15109491]|. Its binding is proposed to be stabilized by DskA. If the demand for rRNA is low, transcription can be inhibited by high levels of ppGpp or low levels of NTPs. RNAP is a direct target of ppGpp action. There are three proposed mechanisms through which ppGpp binding inhibits rRNA transcription: 1) ppGpp binds with the initiating NTP for the active site, 2) ppGpp pairs with a cytosine residue(s) just upstream of the transcription start site, 3) ppGpp decreases the lifetime of the open complex formed at all rRNA promoters |CITS:[15109491]|.
ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE_WEB: ppGpp binds RNA polymerase (RNAP) near the catalytic center in the secondary channel Artsimovitch I, Patlan V, Sekine S, Vassylyeva MN, Hosaka T, Ochi K, Yokoyama S, Vassylyev DG,2004 Its binding is proposed to be stabilized by DskA. If the demand for rRNA is low, transcription can be inhibited by high levels of ppGpp or low levels of NTPs. RNAP is a direct target of ppGpp action. There are three proposed mechanisms through which ppGpp binding inhibits rRNA transcription: 1) ppGpp binds with the initiating NTP for the active site, 2) ppGpp pairs with a cytosine residue(s) just upstream of the transcription start site, 3) ppGpp decreases the lifetime of the open complex formed at all rRNA promoters Artsimovitch I, Patlan V, Sekine S, Vassylyeva MN, Hosaka T, Ochi K, Yokoyama S, Vassylyev DG,2004

ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE: DskA amplifies the magnitude of inhibition effects of ppGpp from rrnBp1 and all rRNAP1 promoters |CITS:[15294157][21402902]|. A model reflecting the contribution of DksA under regulation of rRNA expression has been developed |CITS:[15294157]|.

ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE: ftsQp1, ftsZp4, and ftsZp3 are attractive candidates for ppGpp activation, since they exhibit inverse growth rate regulation. Even so, the effect of ppGpp on the ftsZ gene could be indirect |CITS:[8407846]|.
ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE_WEB: ftsQp1, ftsZp4, and ftsZp3 are attractive candidates for ppGpp activation, since they exhibit inverse growth rate regulation. Even so, the effect of ppGpp on the ftsZ gene could be indirect Vinella D,1993

ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE: There is a discriminator region between -10 and +1 in the flup promoter. This region is required for the positive control by ppGpp |CITS: [32548953]|.
ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE_WEB: There is a discriminator region between -10 and +1 in the flup promoter. This region is required for the positive control by ppGpp Cabrer-Panes JD,2020.

ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE:
ppGpp binds RNA polymerase (RNAP) near the catalytic center in the secondary channel |CITS:[15109491]|. Its binding is proposed to be stabilized by DskA. If the demand for rRNA is low, transcription can be inhibited by high levels of ppGpp or low levels of NTPs. RNAP is a direct target of ppGpp action. There are three proposed mechanisms through which ppGpp binding inhibits rRNA transcription: 1) ppGpp binds with the initiating NTP for the active site, 2) ppGpp pairs with a cytosine residue(s) just upstream of the transcription start site, 3) ppGpp decreases the lifetime of the open complex formed at all rRNA promoters |CITS:[15109491]|.
The regulatory effects on transcription initiation and properties between (p)ppApp with (p)ppGpp were assessed using the well-studied E. coli rrnBP1 promoter. Different from (p)ppGpp, (p)ppApp activates transcription at this promoter, and DksA hinders this effect; in contrast, pppApp exerts a stronger effect than ppApp. The X-ray crystal structure of the RNAP-(p)ppApp complex was determined and which shows that the analogs bind near the active site and switch regions of RNAP |CITS:[30013537]|.
ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE_WEB:
ppGpp binds RNA polymerase (RNAP) near the catalytic center in the secondary channel Artsimovitch I, Patlan V, Sekine S, Vassylyeva MN, Hosaka T, Ochi K, Yokoyama S, Vassylyev DG,2004 Its binding is proposed to be stabilized by DskA. If the demand for rRNA is low, transcription can be inhibited by high levels of ppGpp or low levels of NTPs. RNAP is a direct target of ppGpp action. There are three proposed mechanisms through which ppGpp binding inhibits rRNA transcription: 1) ppGpp binds with the initiating NTP for the active site, 2) ppGpp pairs with a cytosine residue(s) just upstream of the transcription start site, 3) ppGpp decreases the lifetime of the open complex formed at all rRNA promoters Artsimovitch I, Patlan V, Sekine S, Vassylyeva MN, Hosaka T, Ochi K, Yokoyama S, Vassylyev DG,2004
The regulatory effects on transcription initiation and properties between (p)ppApp with (p)ppGpp were assessed using the well-studied E. coli rrnBP1 promoter. Different from (p)ppGpp, (p)ppApp activates transcription at this promoter, and DksA hinders this effect; in contrast, pppApp exerts a stronger effect than ppApp. The X-ray crystal structure of the RNAP-(p)ppApp complex was determined and which shows that the analogs bind near the active site and switch regions of RNAP Klitgaard RN,2018

ROW.INTERACTION_NOTE: DksA weakly inhibited pcnBp3 (pB) transcription |CITS:[20700605]|. Pronounced impairment of pcnBp3 (pB) activity was caused by ppGpp |CITS:[20700605]|.
